byline.original: By WAYNE ARNOLD and JOHN FOLEY

abstract: Reuters BreakingViews column; Olympus could be forced to take write-downs or delist as it faces credibility issues; Singapore investment fund Temasek appears at first glance to have hit on a clever way of raising money cheaply.
snippet: After firing its chief executive and effectively paying two advisers a 35 percent commission for a British acquisition in 2008, Olympus could be forced to take big write-downs or even delist.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies

lead_paragraph: After firing its chief executive and effectively paying two advisers a 35 percent commission for a British acquisition in 2008, Olympus could be forced to take big write-downs or even delist.
